intro: Rochelia borboniae, commonly known as the Bourbon Rochelia, is a rare and striking plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features a robust, woody stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense, spherical clusters that bloom during the dry season. Rochelia borboniae is adapted to thrive in arid environments, making it a unique example of botanical resilience in its native habitat.
